designScenario.description: The Landing Gear Braking System is a vital component in the aircraft's landing gear that ensures rapid and effective deceleration upon touchdown. It integrates high-performance friction components, rapid response actuation systems, and redundant hydraulic circuits to provide safe, reliable performance in both normal and emergency conditions. The system is designed to meet rigorous aviation safety standards and is optimized for maintenance and compliance with aerospace regulations.
designScenario.name: Landing Gear Braking System

details.description: The system must deliver consistent braking force across varying aircraft loads and runway conditions.
It must interface accurately with the Wheel Assembly to manage deceleration forces throughout the landing gear.
The complete engagement of braking systems must occur within 0.5 seconds to ensure rapid deceleration during emergency landings.
Advanced heat dissipation mechanisms should maintain braking performance during continuous or repeated operations.
Incorporate dual hydraulic circuit redundancy to ensure the brake system remains fully operational in the event of a circuit failure.
Integrate system monitoring that alerts the flight crew to any abnormal condition in the braking operation.
The design should support easy inspection, maintenance, and replacement procedures according to aviation maintenance protocols.
Materials and construction techniques must comply with environmental, endurance, and durability standards set for aerospace applications.

relationships.description: Brake System comprises Brake Calipers which actuate to apply pressure for friction generation.
Brake System comprises Brake Discs that provide the friction surfaces required for deceleration.
Brake System is dependent on the Hydraulic System for hydraulic pressure to facilitate brake actuation.
Brake System associates with the Wheel Assembly to transfer braking forces effectively to the landing gear.
